dt: {bc}to confer with another so as to arrive at the settlement of some matter
{bc}to deal with (some matter or affair that requires ability for its successful handling) {bc}{sx|manage||}

dt.t: {it}negotiated{/it} his business deals with remarkable skill

dt: {bc}to arrange for or bring about through conference, discussion, and compromise
{bc}to transfer (something, such as a {d_link|bill of exchange|bill of exchange}) to another by delivery or endorsement {dx_def}see {dxt|endorse||1d}{/dx_def}
{bc}to convert into cash or the equivalent value

et: borrowed from Latin {it}negōtiātus,{/it} past participle of {it}negōtiārī{/it} "to do business, trade, deal," derivative of {it}negōtium{/it} "work, business, difficulty, annoyance," from {it}nec{/it} "not" + {it}ōtium{/it} "free time, leisure, tranquility," of obscure origin {ma}{mat|neglect:1|}{/ma}

The sense "to confer in order to arrive at a settlement" is probably based on Middle French {it}negocier{/it} or Italian {it}negoziare,{/it} which had developed this sense, not belonging to the Latin source, by the mid-16th century.
shortdef: to confer with another so as to arrive at the settlement of some matter
to deal with (some matter or affair that requires ability for its successful handling) : manage
to arrange for or bring about through conference, discussion, and compromise
